Al-Ahqaf berarti "bukit-bukit pasir". Kemudian nama itu dijadikan nama sebuah daerah yang terletak antara negeri Oman dan Mahrah. Daerah itu dinamai demikian oleh kaum 'Ad. Sekarang daerah itu terkenal dengan nama "Sahara al-Ahqaf", dan termasuk salah satu daerah yang menjadi wilayah Kerajaan Saudi Arabia bagian selatan. Daerah itu terletak di sebelah utara Hadramaut, sebelah timur dibatasi oleh laut Yaman, dan sebelah selatan berbatasan dengan Nejed.

Semula kaum 'Ad menganut agama yang berdasarkan tauhid. Setelah berlalu beberapa generasi, kepercayaan tauhid itu dimasuki unsur-unsur syirik, dimulai dengan penghormatan kepada pembesar-pembesar dan pahlawan mereka yang telah meninggal dunia, dengan membuatkan patung-patungnya. Lama-kelamaan, pemberian penghormatan ini berubah menjadi pemberian penghormatan kepada patung, yang akhirnya berubah menjadi penyembahan kepada dewa, dengan arti bahwa pembesar dan pahlawan yang telah meninggal mereka anggap sebagai dewa. Untuk mengembalikan mereka kepada agama yang benar yaitu agama tauhid, Allah mengutus seorang rasul yang diangkat dari keluarga mereka sendiri, yaitu Nabi Hud. Hud menyeru mereka agar kembali kepada kepercayaan yang benar, yaitu kepercayaan tauhid, dengan hanya menyembah Allah semata, tidak lagi mempersekutukan-Nya dengan tuhan-tuhan yang lain.
text.22:
Ketika Nabi Hud menyeru kaumnya untuk beriman, kaum 'Ad menjawab seruan itu dengan mengatakan, "Apakah kamu diutus kepada kami untuk memalingkan kami dari agama nenek moyang kami sehingga kami tidak lagi menyembah tuhan-tuhan kami dan hanya menyembah Tuhanmu?" Mereka meminta kepada Hud membuktikan kerasulannya dengan segera mendatangkan azab yang pernah dijanjikan kepada mereka, seandainya mereka tidak beriman. Bahkan pada ayat yang lain, mereka menuduh Hud sebagai orang gila. Allah berfirman:

Kami hanya mengatakan bahwa sebagian sesembahan kami telah menimpakan penyakit gila atas dirimu. (Hud/11: 54)
text.23:
Pada ayat ini dijelaskan jawaban Nabi Hud atas tantangan orang kafir supaya segera didatangkan azab yang pernah dijanjikan kepada mereka jika mereka tidak beriman. Nabi Hud menjawab bahwa yang mengetahui kapan azab yang diancamkan itu datang hanyalah Allah. Nabi Hud sendiri juga tidak tahu kapan azab itu akan datang. Tugas nabi hanya menyampaikan risalah dari Allah.

Seharusnya kaum 'Ad bersyukur dengan diutusnya salah seorang dari kaum mereka menjadi nabi yang memberi peringatan, informasi tentang hukum, pokok-pokok akidah, dan cara-cara beribadah yang benar. Semua itu disampaikan karena perintah Allah, Tuhan Maha Pencipta segala sesuatu.

Tanpa adanya petunjuk dari Allah tak ada yang mengetahui hakikat agama yang benar. Manusia tidak tahu manakah Tuhan yang benar-benar berhak disembah dan siapa yang berhak menentukan bagaimana cara beribadah yang benar. Oleh karena itu, wajar jika ada manusia yang tidak memahami semua hal, karena pikiran manusia memang terbatas. Di sinilah perlunya Allah mengutus para nabi dan rasul, dan manusia harus berusaha untuk memahami dan meyakininya.
text.24:
Segala macam usaha telah dilakukan Nabi Hud untuk mengajak kaumnya menganut agama yang benar. Bahkan dalam ayat-ayat yang lain diterangkan bahwa Nabi Hud menantang kaumnya agar mereka semua dan dewa-dewa mereka itu bersama-sama melawan dan membunuh dirinya. Namun tantangan itu tidak mereka hiraukan, sehingga Allah memutuskan untuk menimpakan azab kepada mereka.

Azab itu dimulai dengan datangnya musim kemarau panjang yang menimpa negeri mereka. Dalam keadaan demikian, mereka melihat awan hitam berarakan di atas langit dan bergerak menuju negeri mereka. Mereka semua bergembira menyambut kedatangan awan itu. Menurut mereka, awan itu adalah tanda akan hujan dalam waktu dekat, yang selama ini sangat mereka harapkan. Mereka mengatakan, "Ini adalah awan yang membawa hujan." Lalu Nabi Hud menatap awan itu dan memperhatikannya dengan seksama, kemudian beliau berkata, "Awan yang datang bergumpal-gumpal itu bukanlah sebagai tanda akan datangnya hujan sebagaimana yang kamu sangka, tetapi awan itu sebagai tanda datangnya azab yang kamu inginkan dan kamu tunggu-tunggu. Azab yang akan datang untuk menghancurkan kamu berupa angin kencang yang akan membinasakan kamu dan semua yang dilandanya. Dia akan membinasakan kamu dan semua hartamu dan akan menghancurkan seluruh kekuatan dewa-dewa yang selalu kamu bangga-banggakan, sesuai dengan tugas yang diperintahkan Tuhan kepadanya."

Dalam ayat yang lain diterangkan bentuk azab yang ditimpakan kepada kaum 'Ad itu. Allah berfirman:

Sedangkan kaum 'Ad, mereka telah dibinasakan dengan angin topan yang sangat dingin, Allah menimpakan angin itu kepada mereka selama tujuh malam delapan hari terus-menerus; maka kamu melihat kaum 'Ad pada waktu itu mati bergelimpangan seperti batang-batang pohon kurma yang telah kosong (lapuk). Maka adakah kamu melihat seorang pun yang masih tersisa di antara mereka. (al-haqqah/69: 6-8).

Dan firman Allah:

Dan (juga) pada (kisah kaum) 'Ad, ketika Kami kirimkan kepada mereka angin yang membinasakan. (Angin itu) tidak membiarkan suatu apa pun yang dilandanya, bahkan dijadikannya seperti serbuk. (adh-dzariyat/51: 41-42)

Bagaimana kedahsyatan azab yang telah ditimpakan kepada kaum 'Ad itu tergambar pada sikap Rasulullah saw sewaktu angin kencang bertiup. Di dalam suatu hadis diterangkan sebagai berikut: 

'Aisyah berkata, "Rasulullah saw apabila ada angin kencang bertiup, beliau berdoa, 'Wahai Tuhan, aku mohon kepada Engkau angin yang paling baik; baik isinya dan paling baik pula yang dibawanya, dan aku berlindung kepada Engkau dari angin yang buruk; buruk isinya dan buruk pula yang dibawanya. Apabila langit memperlihatkan gejala-gejala akan turunnya hujan berubahlah muka Rasulullah saw. Beliau mondar-mandir keluar masuk rumah, ke muka dan ke belakang. Maka apabila hujan telah turun legalah hati beliau, lalu aku bertanya kepada beliau, beliau menjawab, 'Aku tidak mengetahui, mudah-mudahan saja seperti yang dikatakan kaum 'Ad, 'Awan yang datang ini menurunkan hujan kepada kita." (Riwayat Muslim, at-Tirmidhi, dan an-Nasa'i) 

Rasulullah juga bersabda sebagai berikut:

'Aisyah berkata, "Aku tidak pernah melihat Rasulullah saw tertawa lebar hingga kelihatan anak lidahnya. Beliau hanya tersenyum, sedang apabila beliau melihat awan dan angin, berubah raut mukanya. Aku bertanya kepada beliau, 'Ya Rasulullah aku lihat orang apabila melihat awan mereka bergembira karena mengharapkan semoga awan itu membuat hujan, sedangkan engkau aku lihat bila melihat awan kelihatan perasaan kurang senang di mukamu. Rasulullah saw menjawab, 'Ya 'Aisyah, siapa yang dapat menjamin bahwa awan itu tidak membawa azab? Pernah suatu kaum diazab dengan angin itu. Sesungguhnya kaum itu melihat azab, tetapi mereka menyangkanya awan yang membawa hujan, maka berkatalah mereka, 'Awan itu datang membawa hujan kepada kita." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim) 

Pada hadis lain yang diriwayatkan Muslim diterangkan:

Ibnu 'Abbas menerangkan bahwa Nabi saw pernah bersabda, "Saya ditolong oleh angin timur, dan kaum 'Ad dihancurkan dengan angin barat." (Riwayat Muslim)
text.25: Dalam ayat ini, Allah memperingatkan orang-orang musyrik Mekah bahwa Dia telah menimpakan azab yang amat dahsyat kepada kaum 'Ad. Demikian dahsyatnya azab itu sehingga apa saja yang dilanda oleh azab berupa angin amat dingin yang bertiup dengan keras itu, pasti hancur. Mereka mati bergelimpangan. Rumah-rumah dan bangunan-bangunan runtuh, barang-barang beterbangan, pohon-pohon kayu tumbang. Tidak ada yang kelihatan lagi, kecuali puing-puing dan tempat tinggal mereka yang telah berserakan. Azab yang seperti itu juga telah menimpa kaum-kaum yang lain, seperti kaum Samud, kaum Lut, dan kaum Syuaib. Semua mereka itu adalah orang-orang yang ingkar dan durhaka kepada Allah. Seandainya kaum Quraisy tetap ingkar, mereka akan ditimpa azab seperti itu pula.
text.26:
Dengan ayat ini, Allah membandingkan antara keadaan kaum 'Ad yang dihancurkan dengan orang-orang musyrik Mekah yang semakin bertambah keingkarannya kepada Nabi saw dengan mengatakan, "Kami telah meneguhkan kedudukan kaum 'Ad pada beberapa segi kehidupan duniawi. Belum pernah Kami meneguhkan satu kaum seperti Kami meneguhkan mereka. Kami telah memberikan kepada mereka harta yang banyak, tubuh yang kuat dan perkasa, dan kemampuan untuk membentuk suatu negara sehingga mereka dapat menguasai negeri-negeri di sekitarnya, tetapi semuanya itu tidak dapat menghindarkan mereka dari azab Allah yang ditimpakan kepada mereka." Allah berfirman:

Maka apakah mereka tidak mengadakan perjalanan di bumi, lalu mereka memperhatikan bagaimana kesudahan orang-orang yang sebelum mereka. Mereka itu lebih banyak dan lebih hebat kekuatannya serta (lebih banyak) peninggalan-peninggalan peradabannya di bumi, maka apa yang mereka usahakan itu tidak dapat menolong mereka. (Gafir/40: 82)

Selanjutnya ayat 26 ini menjelaskan bahwa Allah telah memberikan banyak kenikmatan kepada kaum 'Ad. Allah telah memberikan tempat yang baik kepada mereka, menganugerahkan penglihatan yang baik, dan pendengaran yang tajam agar mereka dapat memperhatikan ayat-ayat dan tanda-tanda kebesaran Allah. Akan tetapi, mereka tidak mempergunakannya, bahkan semuanya itu tidak mereka manfaatkan dengan baik dan benar.

Sejarah telah membuktikan bahwa kaum 'Ad pernah mempunyai kebudayaan yang tinggi. Mereka telah sanggup menyusun pemerintahan dan membangun negara. Mereka telah membangun istana, benteng, menggali barang tambang dari perut bumi, dan membuat kanal untuk menciptakan irigasi yang teratur. Dengan adanya irigasi yang teratur itu, tanah negeri mereka menjadi subur. Mereka dapat pula mengolah tanah dengan baik sehingga mereka hidup makmur. Di samping itu, mereka juga mampu membentuk tentara yang kuat sehingga negara mereka menjadi negara yang terkemuka di Jazirah Arab pada masa itu. Firman Allah: 

Apakah kamu mendirikan istana-istana pada setiap tanah yang tinggi untuk kemegahan tanpa ditempati, dan kamu membuat benteng-benteng dengan harapan kamu hidup kekal? (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 128-129)

Seharusnya kenikmatan dan kebesaran yang telah dianugerahkan Allah menjadi bahan pemikiran bagi mereka tentang siapa yang telah menolongnya mencapai semua yang mereka cita-citakan. Tetapi semuanya itu menambah kesombongan dan ketakaburan mereka. Mereka mengira bahwa keadaan yang demikian itu mereka peroleh semata-mata atas kesanggupan dan kemauan mereka, dan keadaan itu akan mereka punyai selama-lamanya. Allah berfirman:

Maka adapun kaum 'Ad, mereka menyombongkan diri di bumi tanpa (mengindahkan) kebenaran dan mereka berkata, "Siapakah yang lebih hebat kekuatannya dari kami?" Tidakkah mereka memperhatikan bahwa sesungguhnya Allah yang menciptakan mereka. Dia lebih hebat kekuatan-Nya daripada mereka? Dan mereka telah mengingkari tanda-tanda (kebesaran) Kami. (Fussilat/41: 15)

Selanjutnya Allah menerangkan bahwa kaum 'Ad tidak dapat mengambil manfaat dari semua yang telah dianugerahkan kepada mereka, karena mereka mendustakan seruan rasul yang diutus kepada mereka serta mengingkari mukjizat-mukjizat rasul. Akibatnya, mereka ditimpa azab yang selalu mereka minta untuk disegerakan, karena menurut mereka azab itu mustahil akan terjadi.
text.27:
Allah mengingatkan kaum musyrik Mekah agar mereka mengambil pelajaran dari pengalaman pahit yang telah dialami oleh orang-orang dahulu, yang telah mendustakan rasul yang diutus kepada mereka. Orang-orang dahulu itu bertempat tinggal tidak jauh dari Mekah seperti kaum 'Ad di Ahqaf, dan kaum Samud yang berdiam di daerah antara Mekah dan Syam. Kepada mereka telah diterangkan pula tanda-tanda keesaan, kekuasaan, dan kebesaran Allah dan telah disampaikan pula agama-Nya. Akan tetapi, mereka tidak mengacuhkannya, bahkan mengingkari dan memperolok-olokkan para rasul. Pada waktu azab menimpa mereka, tidak ada satu pun dari sembahan-sembahan itu yang dapat menolong mereka, bahkan sembahan-sembahan berupa patung yang tak bernyawa itu ikut hancur-lebur bersama mereka.

Itulah kebohongan dan pengingkaran umat-umat dahulu dan itu pula balasan dan azab yang mereka terima. Dari ayat ini, terkandung suatu ancaman Allah kepada orang-orang musyrik Mekah bahwa mereka pasti ditimpa azab, seperti yang dialami kaum 'Ad, Samud, dan umat yang lain apabila mereka tetap tidak mengindahkan seruan Muhammad saw sebagai rasul Allah yang diutus kepada mereka.
text.28:
Allah mengingatkan kaum musyrik Mekah agar mereka mengambil pelajaran dari pengalaman pahit yang telah dialami oleh orang-orang dahulu, yang telah mendustakan rasul yang diutus kepada mereka. Orang-orang dahulu itu bertempat tinggal tidak jauh dari Mekah seperti kaum 'Ad di Ahqaf, dan kaum Samud yang berdiam di daerah antara Mekah dan Syam. Kepada mereka telah diterangkan pula tanda-tanda keesaan, kekuasaan, dan kebesaran Allah dan telah disampaikan pula agama-Nya. Akan tetapi, mereka tidak mengacuhkannya, bahkan mengingkari dan memperolok-olokkan para rasul. Pada waktu azab menimpa mereka, tidak ada satu pun dari sembahan-sembahan itu yang dapat menolong mereka, bahkan sembahan-sembahan berupa patung yang tak bernyawa itu ikut hancur-lebur bersama mereka.

Itulah kebohongan dan pengingkaran umat-umat dahulu dan itu pula balasan dan azab yang mereka terima. Dari ayat ini, terkandung suatu ancaman Allah kepada orang-orang musyrik Mekah bahwa mereka pasti ditimpa azab, seperti yang dialami kaum 'Ad, Samud, dan umat yang lain apabila mereka tetap tidak mengindahkan seruan Muhammad saw sebagai rasul Allah yang diutus kepada mereka.
text.29:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan kepada Rasulullah saw agar menyampaikan kepada orang-orang musyrik Mekah peristiwa tentang pertemuannya dengan sekelompok jin yang telah datang kepadanya untuk mendengarkan dan memperhatikan pembacaan ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an. Pada waktu mereka mendengarkan bacaannya, di antara mereka ada yang berkata kepada yang lain, "Dengarlah baik-baik bacaan Al-Qur'an ini agar dengan demikian kita dapat memusatkan perhatian kepada bacaan yang belum pernah kita dengar selama ini dan untuk menunjukkan sikap dan budi pekerti yang baik pada waktu mendengarkan pembacaan ayat Al-Qur'an yang mulia ini." Setelah mereka selesai mendengarkan bacaan Al-Qur'an itu, mereka kembali kepada kaumnya untuk menyampaikan apa yang telah mereka dengarkan itu.

Dalam ayat ini diterangkan bahwa jin telah mendengarkan pembacaan ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an dari Nabi saw. Bagaimana cara jin mendengarkan pembacaan itu dan bagaimana Nabi saw memperdengarkannya tidak ada keterangan yang menerangkannya dengan jelas. Demikian pula, tidak ada bukti-bukti nyata yang dapat dikemukakan dengan pasti adanya alam jin itu sendiri. 

Adanya alam jin itu hanya didapat dari ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an dan hadis Nabi saw. Maka kita sebagai umat Islam wajib mempercayai adanya jin itu, sebagaimana kita wajib mempercayai adanya malaikat, karena kepercayaan kepada adanya jin dan malaikat termasuk dalam keimanan kepada seluruh isi Al-Qur'an yang merupakan sumber pokok agama Islam.

Malaikat dan jin termasuk makhluk gaib, karena itu hanya Allah saja yang mengetahui dengan pasti tentang hakikat dan kejadiannya. Seorang Muslim wajib percaya bahwa Nabi Muhammad pernah berhubungan dengan malaikat, seperti ketika menerima wahyu dan sebagainya. Demikian pula seorang Muslim wajib percaya pula bahwa pada suatu waktu, ketika Rasulullah saw masih hidup, beliau pernah berhubungan dengan jin, yaitu ketika membacakan ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an kepada mereka, dan waktu mereka mendengarkan dengan sungguh-sungguh, kemudian menyampaikan kepada kaumnya.

Mengenai hadis-hadis Rasulullah yang menerangkan pertemuan beliau dengan serombongan jin antara lain hadis di bawah ini:

Masruq berkata, "Aku bertanya kepada Ibnu Mas'ud tentang siapa yang memberitahukan kepada Nabi Muhammad saw akan kehadiran jin pada malam mereka mendengarkan bacaan Al-Qur'an," beliau menjawab, "Yang memberitahukan kehadiran mereka ialah pohon kayu itu." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim)

Pada hadis yang lain disebutkan sebagai berikut:

'Alqamah berkata, "Aku bertanya kepada Ibnu Mas'ud, adakah salah seorang di antara kamu yang menyertai Rasulullah saw pada malam pertemuannya dengan jin?" Ibnu Mas'ud menjawab, "Tidak seorang pun di antara kami yang menyertainya." (Riwayat Ahmad, Muslim, dan at-Tirmidhi)

Ayat ini diturunkan ketika Rasulullah saw dan para sahabat sedang menghadapi tantangan yang sangat berat dari kaum musyrik Mekah. Setelah istri yang beliau cintai, Khadijah wafat, kemudian disusul dengan wafatnya paman beliau, Abu thalib, beliau merasa kehilangan orang-orang yang selama ini melindungi dan menolong beliau dari gangguan orang-orang Quraisy. Sementara itu, ancaman dan gangguan orang Quraisy semakin bertambah. Menghadapi keadaan semacam ini beliau pergi ke kota thaif dengan harapan akan mendapat perlindungan dan pertolongan dari Bani saqif. Tetapi beliau tidak memperoleh apa yang diharapkannya, bahkan Bani saqif sendiri bertindak kasar dengan menyuruh budak-budak mereka mengusir dan melempari Rasulullah saw sehingga kaki beliau luka dan berdarah. Mereka memaksa Rasulullah saw melarikan diri ke kebun 'Utbah dan Syaibah. Di sana beliau berlindung dari teriknya matahari. Setelah beliau berdoa meminta pertolongan dari Allah, barulah budak-budak itu pergi. Kemudian Rasulullah kembali ke Mekah. Dalam perjalanan itu, beliau singgah di Nakhlah, suatu tempat di pinggir kota Mekah. Beliau bermalam di sana. Maka pada malam ketika beliau sedang salat dan membaca Al-Qur'an dalam salat itu, Allah mengerahkan tujuh pemuka jin untuk mendengarkan Nabi saw membaca Al-Qur'an. Beliau tidak mengetahui akan kedatangan jin dan beliau juga tidak mengetahui saat jin itu kembali ke tempatnya. Dengan turunnya ayat ini barulah Rasulullah saw mengetahui kedatangan jin itu.

Ayat ini diturunkan untuk menenteramkan hati Nabi dan para sahabatnya. Tidak lama setelah itu, terjadilah peristiwa Isra' dan Mi'raj. Kedua peristiwa itu menambah kuat hati Nabi dan keyakinannya akan keberhasilannya menyampaikan risalah yang ditugaskan Allah kepadanya.

Ayat ini juga menerangkan bahwa jin memperhatikan ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an yang dibaca Rasulullah, kemudian menyampaikan isi Al-Qur'an itu kepada kaumnya. Dari peristiwa ini, dapat diambil kesimpulan bahwa seruan Rasulullah saw itu tidak saja tertuju kepada seluruh manusia, tetapi juga ditujukan kepada jin, makhluk gaib yang tidak dapat diketahui hakikat dan keadaannya oleh manusia. Hanya saja kita manusia tidak mengetahui kapan dan bagaimana caranya jin itu melaksanakan perintah dan menjauhi larangan Allah.

Sebagian ahli tafsir mengambil kesimpulan berdasarkan ayat ini bahwa seandainya ada makhluk hidup yang berada di luar planet bumi ini, yang keadaannya seperti manusia, yaitu dapat berpikir, berbuat, dan berperasaan, maka risalah Muhammad saw berlaku pula bagi mereka, dan kaum Muslimin wajib menyampaikannya kepada mereka sedapat mungkin. Jin sebagai makhluk gaib wajib melaksanakan risalah Muhammad saw dan tentulah makhluk lain yang tidak gaib dan sama dengan manusia lebih wajib lagi melaksanakan risalah Muhammad saw.
text.30:
Dalam ayat ini diterangkan bahwa serombongan jin yang telah mendengar bacaan Al-Qur'an dari Nabi Muhammad saw menyeru kaumnya, "Wahai kaumku, sesungguhnya kami telah mendengar pembacaan ayat-ayat sebuah kitab yang telah diturunkan Allah setelah Kitab Taurat yang diturunkan kepada Nabi Musa. Kitab itu membenarkan kitab-kitab yang diturunkan Allah sebelumnya, menunjukkan jalan yang paling baik ditempuh seseorang yang ingin mencapai kebahagiaan hidup di dunia dan kebahagiaan hidup di akhirat serta menerangkan jalan yang diridai dan jalan yang tidak diridai Allah." Jin juga makhluk yang harus memikul kewajiban beribadah. Firman Allah:

. 

Aku tidak menciptakan jin dan manusia melainkan agar mereka beribadah kepada-Ku. (adh-dzariyat/51: 56)
text.31:
Selanjutnya jin-jin itu menyeru kaumnya, "Wahai kaumku, perkenankanlah dan terimalah seruan Muhammad saw sebagai rasul Allah yang telah menyeru manusia untuk mengikuti agama Allah, beriman kepada-Nya agar Allah mengampuni dosa-dosa mereka dan melindungi mereka dari azab yang tidak seorang pun dapat melepaskan diri dari azab itu, kecuali dengan seizin-Nya." Ayat ini memberi pengertian bahwa:

1. Meskipun ada jin yang beriman dan ada pula yang kafir, namun dalam ayat ini mereka diseru agar beriman kepada Allah.

2. Jin berkewajiban beribadah kepada Allah. Oleh karena itu, jin menerima syariat sebagaimana syariat yang disampaikan oleh para nabi dan rasul kepada manusia.

3. Jin yang beriman akan selamat dari api neraka.
text.32:
Kemudian diterangkan dalam ayat ini bahwa jika ada di antara jin yang menolak seruan Muhammad sebagai rasul Allah, yaitu tidak melaksanakan perintah Allah dan menjauhkan diri dari larangan-Nya yang tersebut dalam Al-Qur'an dan hadis, maka ia tidak dapat menghindarkan diri dari azab-Nya. Ia tidak mendapat seorang penolong pun untuk melepaskan dirinya dari azab Allah, kecuali jika Allah sendiri menghendakinya.

Dari ayat ini dapat dipahami bahwa seluruh ibadah yang diwajibkan kepada kaum Muslimin diwajibkan pula kepada seluruh jin untuk mengerjakannya, seperti salat, puasa, tolong-menolong, dan sebagainya. Diterangkan pula bahwa jin-jin yang tidak mengikuti seruan Muhammad saw berada dalam kesesatan dan menyimpang dari jalan yang benar.
text.33:
Ayat ini merupakan teguran keras kepada orang-orang kafir yang mengingkari hari kebangkitan, dan adanya hidup setelah mati untuk menghisab perbuatan yang telah dilakukan manusia. Allah mencela orang-orang kafir yang lalai dan tidak pernah merenungkan kejadian alam semesta ini sehingga tidak mengetahui bahwa Allah yang telah menciptakan langit dan bumi tidak pernah merasa letih dalam penciptaan itu. Allah juga berkuasa menghidupkan yang telah mati.

Dari ayat ini dipahami bahwa orang kafir tidak pernah menggunakan pikirannya untuk merenungkan kejadian alam semesta dalam arti yang sebenarnya. Mereka tidak mau memikirkan siapa pencipta alam yang amat teratur dan dilengkapi dengan hukum-hukum yang sangat rapi dan kokoh. Mereka juga tidak mau memikirkan siapa yang menciptakan dirinya sendiri dan menjaga kelangsungan hidupnya. Seandainya mereka mau memikirkan dengan tujuan ingin mencari kebenaran, mereka akan sampai kepada kesimpulan bahwa pencipta semua itu adalah Allah yang Maha Bijaksana lagi Mahakuasa. Jika Dia Mahakuasa, tentulah Dia sanggup melaksanakan segala sesuatu yang dikehendaki-Nya, tanpa mengenal lelah. Zat yang bersifat demikian tentu mudah bagi-Nya menghidupkan kembali orang-orang yang telah dimatikan-Nya, karena menciptakan langit dan bumi itu jauh lebih sukar daripada menciptakan manusia serta mematikan dan menghidupkan kembali.

Allah berfirman:

Sungguh, penciptaan langit dan bumi itu lebih besar daripada penciptaan manusia, akan tetapi kebanyakan manusia tidak mengetahui. (Gafir/40: 57)

Selain itu, biasanya membuat kembali sesuatu lebih mudah dari menciptakan pertama kalinya. Allah berfirman:

Dan Dialah yang memulai penciptaan, kemudian mengulanginya kembali, dan itu lebih mudah bagi-Nya. Dia memiliki sifat yang Mahatinggi di langit dan di bumi. Dan Dialah Yang Mahaperkasa, Mahabijaksana. (ar-Rum/30: 27)

Pada akhir ayat ini ditegaskan bahwa yang Maha Pencipta segala sesuatu lagi Mahaperkasa itu adalah Allah Yang Mahakuasa. Dia dapat melakukan segala yang dikehendaki-Nya, tanpa seorang pun dapat menghalangi dan menentang-Nya.
text.34:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan akibat yang akan diterima oleh orang-orang yang mengingkari adanya hari kebangkitan. Pada hari kebangkitan itu, mereka dan orang-orang yang tidak percaya akan adanya pahala dan siksa Allah, akan dimasukkan ke dalam api neraka yang menyala-nyala.

Kepada orang-orang kafir diucapkan pertanyaan yang menyakitkan hati dan penuh penghinaan, "Hai orang-orang kafir, bukankah azab yang kamu rasakan hari ini adalah azab yang pernah diperingatkan kepada kamu dahulu, semasa kamu hidup di dunia, sedangkan kamu mendustakan dan memperolok-olokkannya." Mereka menjawab, "Benar ya Tuhan kami, kami benar-benar telah merasakan akibatnya." Allah mengatakan kepada mereka, "Sekarang rasakanlah olehmu apa yang kamu perolok-olokkan itu. Inilah balasan yang setimpal dengan sikap dan tindakanmu itu."
text.35:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan kepada Nabi Muhammad agar selalu tetap tabah dalam menghadapi sikap dan tindakan orang-orang kafir yang mengingkari dan mendustakan risalah yang disampaikan kepada mereka seperti ketabahan dan kesabaran yang telah dilakukan rasul-rasul ulul 'azmi terdahulu. Rasulullah saw melaksanakan dengan baik perintah Allah ini. Beliau selalu bersabar dan tabah menghadapi segala macam cobaan yang datang kepada beliau. Mengenai kesabaran beliau ini diterangkan dalam hadis sebagai berikut:

Dari 'Aisyah, ia berkata, "Rasulullah saw senantiasa berpuasa, lalu perutnya jadi kempis, kemudian ia tetap berpuasa, lalu perutnya jadi kempis, kemudian ia berpuasa. Beliau berkata, 'Ya Aisyah, sesungguhnya kesenangan di dunia tidak patut bagi Muhammad dan keluarganya. Ya Aisyah, sesungguhnya Allah tidak menyukai para rasul ulul 'azmi (Nuh, Ibrahim, Musa, Isa, dan Muhammad), kecuali bersabar atas segala cobaannya dan bersabar atas yang dicintainya, kemudian Allah tidak menyukai aku, kecuali Dia membebankan kepadaku seperti yang telah dibebankannya kepada para rasul itu. Maka Dia berkata, 'Bersabarlah seperti para rasul 'ulul 'azmi telah bersabar. Dan sesungguhnya aku, demi Allah, benar-benar akan bersabar seperti para rasul itu, dan tidak ada sesuatu pun kekuatan kecuali kekuatan Allah." (Riwayat Ibnu Abi hatim dan ad-Dailami) 

Sabar adalah sifat utama dan kunci menuju kesuksesan. Berbahagialah orang yang mempunyai sifat itu. Lawan dari sabar ialah tergesa-gesa. Dalam ayat ini, Allah mencela sifat tergesa-gesa, dan memperingatkan Nabi Muhammad agar jangan mempunyai sifat tersebut seperti memohon kepada Allah agar segera ditimpakan azab kepada orang-orang musyrik yang mengingkari seruan beliau karena azab itu pasti menimpa mereka, dan waktu kedatangannya hanya Allah yang mengetahui.

Allah berfirman:

Dan biarkanlah Aku (yang bertindak) terhadap orang-orang yang mendustakan, yang memiliki segala kenikmatan hidup, dan berilah mereka penangguhan sebentar. (al-Muzzammil/73: 11)

Dan firman Allah:

Karena itu berilah penangguhan kepada orang-orang kafir itu. Berilah mereka itu kesempatan untuk sementara waktu. (ath-thariq/86: 17)

Berikutnya Allah menerangkan keadaan orang-orang kafir di akhirat ketika melihat azab yang akan menimpa mereka. Mereka merasa seakan-akan hidup di dunia ini hanya sesaat saja, di siang hari. Perasaan ini timbul karena dosa dan ketakutan yang timbul di hati mereka ketika melihat azab yang akan menimpa mereka. Keadaan mereka diterangkan Allah pada ayat yang lain ketika kepada mereka ditanyakan berapa lama mereka hidup di dunia.

Dia (Allah) berfirman, "Berapa tahunkah lamanya kamu tinggal di bumi?" Mereka menjawab, "Kami tinggal (di bumi) sehari atau setengah hari, maka tanyakanlah kepada mereka yang menghitung." (al-Mu'minun/23: 112-113)

Dan firman Allah:

Pada hari ketika mereka melihat hari Kiamat itu (karena suasananya hebat), mereka merasa seakan-akan hanya (sebentar saja) tinggal (di dunia) pada waktu sore atau pagi hari. (an-Nazi'at/79: 46)

Dalam ayat ini terdapat perkataan "balag" yang dalam ayat ini berarti "cukup". Maksudnya ialah: Allah menyatakan bahwa ayat ini merupakan penjelasan yang cukup bagi manusia, terutama orang-orang kafir yang mau berpikir dan merenungkan kejadian alam semesta ini. Seandainya mereka tidak mau mengindahkan penjelasan ini, mereka pasti akan menanggung akibatnya. Dalam ayat yang lain Allah berfirman:

Dan (Al-Qur'an) ini adalah penjelasan (yang sempurna) bagi manusia, agar mereka diberi peringatan dengannya, agar mereka mengetahui bahwa Dia adalah Tuhan Yang Maha Esa dan agar orang yang berakal mengambil pelajaran. (Ibrahim/14: 52)

Dan firman Allah:

Sungguh, (apa yang disebutkan) di dalam (Al-Qur'an) ini, benar-benar menjadi petunjuk (yang lengkap) bagi orang-orang yang menyembah (Allah). (al-Anbiya'/21: 106)

Pada akhir ayat ini Allah menegaskan bahwa betapapun besar dan dahsyatnya azab Allah itu, tidak akan menimpa orang-orang yang beriman dan beramal saleh. Hanya orang-orang kafir yang tidak mengindahkan perintah-perintah Allah dan melanggar larangan-larangan-Nya saja yang akan ditimpa azab yang mengerikan itu. Ayat ini juga menggambarkan betapa besarnya rahmat dan karunia Allah yang dilimpahkan kepada orang-orang yang taat kepada-Nya. Sehubungan dengan rahmat dan karunia, azab dan malapetaka ini, Rasulullah saw sering berdoa kepada Allah, seperti yang tersebut dalam hadis di bawah ini:

"Diriwayatkan dari Anas, Nabi saw berdoa, "Wahai Tuhan, sesungguhnya aku memohon kepada Engkau penyebab rahmat-Mu, kepastian ampunan-Mu, dan keberuntungan dari segala kebaikan, dan keselamatan dari setiap perbuatan dosa. Wahai Tuhan, janganlah Engkau biarkan satu dosa pun bagiku, kecuali Engkau mengampuninya, dan kesempitan kecuali Engkau melapangkannya, dan hutang kecuali Engkau membayarnya, demikian pula segala keperluan dari keperluan-keperluan duniawi dan ukhrawi, kecuali Engkau menyelesaikannya dengan rahmat Engkau, wahai Tuhan Yang Maha Pemurah. (Riwayat ath-thabrani)

text.1: Ha Mim is among the letters of the Arabic alphabet that appear at the beginning of several surahs of the Qur'an. The commentators of the Qur'an have differing opinions regarding the meaning of these letters. For further clarification, please refer back to the explanation at the beginning of Surah al-Baqarah in volume I of "Al-Qur'an dan Tafsirnya" under the title "Fawatihus-suwar".
text.2:
Allah affirms that this Al-Qur'an truly originates from Him, there is not the slightest doubt about it, revealed to the Prophet Muhammad, containing provisions, guidance, and a way of life for mankind to achieve happiness in this world and the hereafter. Allah, who revealed the Al-Qur'an to Muhammad saw, is the Almighty Lord, nothing can match Him. He is the All-Wise. All of Allah's commands, prohibitions, and actions are in accordance with the nature, usefulness, and benefits of what He created, and this is inseparable from the wisdom of the creation of the entire universe.

Because the Al-Qur'an originates from Allah and was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad, every human being should believe in it, acknowledge its truth, and practice all its contents. Believing in the Al-Qur'an also means the necessity of believing in the Prophet Muhammad as the Messenger of Allah, namely by following all of his *sunnah*.
text.3:
After affirming that the Qur'an is His revelation, not a fabrication of Muhammad saw, Allah explains that He is the One who created the heavens and the earth and everything in between. This creation contains wisdom, even though humans have not yet been able to know all of that wisdom. Humans must always strive to explore that wisdom in order to utilize the messages of the Qur'an.

In another verse, it is explained that among the purposes of Allah creating the earth and everything on it is for the benefit of mankind. Allah says:

"Our Lord! You have not created all of this without purpose. Glory be to You! Save us from the torment of the Fire." (Ali 'Imran/3: 191)

In another verse, it is explained that Allah did not create the heavens and the earth to cause injustice and destruction, but to bring forth and prove truth and justice. In declaring that justice, Allah distinguishes between those who do good and those who do evil, both in His attitude towards them and in giving recompense for their deeds. Allah says:

"And Allah created the heavens and the earth for a true purpose, so that every soul may be rewarded for what it has earned. And none will be wronged." (al-Jatsiyah/45: 22)

Allah created the heavens and the earth for a time determined by Him, so that during that time there is an opportunity for humans to do everything that is good for them, in accordance with Allah's provisions, so that they can enjoy true happiness in life. This is certainly in accordance with the potential and the right of free will that Allah has given them.

Because Allah has created the heavens and the earth with all their wisdom and benefits, then to show His justice and prove the wisdom of their creation, Allah created the Day of Judgment. With the existence of the Day of Judgment, all human actions can be justly rewarded. The Day of Judgment will come after the end of the time determined for the heavens and the earth. On that Day of Judgment, rewards are determined for those who carry out Allah's commands and avoid His prohibitions in the form of eternal happiness in Paradise. As for those who deny Allah's commands and violate His prohibitions, they will obtain the misery they experience in Hell.

Statements regarding the creation of the heavens and the earth being done with a true purpose are frequently found in the Qur'an (among others, Surah Ibrahim/14: 19). In verse 3 of Surah al-Ahqaf/46, the words "within a specified period" are added. These words can be interpreted as meaning that God is telling us about the time it took for the earth to form and become habitable. A more straightforward description of the time or period of creation is found in Surah al-A'raf/7: 54 (see explanation in juz 8).

At the end of this verse, the denial of the polytheists to the warnings that have been conveyed to them is explained. It is explained that even though they have been given strong evidence about the truth of the Qur'an as the word of Allah, the appointment of Muhammad saw as His messenger, and the religion brought by Muhammad saw, they remain in polytheism. They continue to turn away from that warning by denying Allah's commands and violating His prohibitions, even rejecting the arguments and evidence without a valid reason. They are like people who are deaf, mute, blind, and without reason, so they cannot hear and understand the call and warning. They do not want to believe that their negligence and denial will cause continuous regret in the afterlife, in addition to experiencing very severe torment.
text.4:
After affirming that He is the only one worthy of worship, He is the God who is Most Gracious, Most Merciful, and Most Just, and after affirming the existence of the Day of Recompense, Allah shows the error of the beliefs of the polytheists who worship objects of worship other than Allah. He commands Prophet Muhammad to say to those who worship objects of worship other than Allah as follows, "O polytheists, explain to me about the idols you worship, after you have observed the creation of the heavens and the earth and what is in them, after observing the laws that apply to celestial bodies, the universe from the smallest to the largest, from the visible to the invisible, from the subtle to the coarse, also after you have observed the creation of animals, plants, to the creation of yourselves, all of which are created neatly, beautifully, beneficially, and full of wisdom. Is there anything on this earth that has been created by an idol so that it is worthy and entitled to be worshipped? Or has it created something in the heavens together with Allah?"

From this verse, it can be understood that the polytheists are unable to prove with logical arguments that idols are entitled to be worshipped alongside Allah because they cannot show even one small object among the objects on this earth as the creation of that idol. In fact, what is proven is that the idol itself is the result of their own making.

The end of this verse affirms that in the holy books that Allah has revealed to His messengers, there is not a single statement that explains that idols must be worshipped alongside Allah. Likewise, in the knowledge inherited by the ancients, there is no information that serves as a basis for the worship of idols. This is what Allah commanded to be conveyed to the polytheists, "O polytheists, if the belief in worshipping idols is true, then present just one verse from the verses found in the holy books revealed before the Qur'an that justifies your belief, or the knowledge of the ancients that you have that justifies that polytheistic belief."
text.5: In this verse, Allah explains that the polytheists who worship idols without any valid reason are misguided because they worship something that cannot do, see, or hear anything, let alone grant the prayers of those who pray to it. It cannot do this in this world, and certainly even less so in the Hereafter. These idols are actually dead stones or wood carved by humans themselves. Therefore, they cannot hear, understand, or pay attention to those who pray to them. The righteous person is the one who adheres to the correct creed, which is the creed of *tauhid* (monotheism) that leads people to worship only Allah, the One God, the Creator, the Determiner of all things, who guides people to the path of happiness in this world and the Hereafter.
text.6:
This verse explains the state of the polytheists in the afterlife and the idols they worshipped. At the time when all humans have been resurrected from their graves and gathered to be judged, the idols, gods, and other objects of worship that they worshipped besides Allah will deny the actions of the polytheists who worshipped them, saying, "We never commanded them to worship us. We did not know what they did to us, we did not even know in the slightest that they had worshipped us because we are inanimate objects, unable to see, hear, speak, let alone grant the prayers of those who pray to us." Allah says:

"And he (Abraham) said, "You have only taken, besides Allah, idols as a bond of affection among you in worldly life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers." (al-'Ankabut/29: 25)

In another verse, Allah says:

"And they have taken gods besides Allah that they might be for them [a source of] strength. No! Those [gods] will deny their worship of them and will be against them adversaries." (Maryam/19: 81-82)
text.7:
This verse explains the attitude of the polytheists when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited the verses of the Qur'an to them. They said that the verses of the Qur'an were magic recited by a magician, namely Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). According to them, magicians usually fabricate lies and bewitch other people to achieve their goals.

In another verse, the accusations of the polytheists against the Qur'an are explained, that the Qur'an is a confused dream that is fabricated, and Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) is a poet. Allah says:

"Nay, they say, "(These are) medleys of dreams! Nay, he has invented it! Nay, he is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a sign like the ones that were sent to (the earlier) Messengers!" (al-Anbiya'/21: 5)

The polytheists accused Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) of being a magician because, according to them, Abu al-Walid bin al-Mugirah had been bewitched by him. Because of the influence of that magic, he expressed his admiration for the verses of the Qur'an that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited to him. This story began when, at one time, before the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) migrated to Medina, the leaders of the Quraysh gathered to discuss ways to subdue the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). After deliberation, they finally agreed to send Abu al-Walid, an Arab literary figure who was unparalleled at that time, to come to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and ask him to stop conveying his message. In response, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited Surah 41 (Fussilat) from beginning to end. Abu al-Walid was fascinated to hear the recitation of the verse; he pondered the loftiness of its content and the beauty of its language style. Then he immediately returned to his people, without saying a word to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).

After Abu al-Walid returned, he was asked by his people about the results of his efforts. They were surprised why Abu al-Walid looked gloomy. Abu al-Walid replied, "I have come to Muhammad and he answered by reciting the verses of the Qur'an to me. I have never heard words as beautiful as that. But those words are not poetry, not magic, and not the words of soothsayers. Indeed, the Qur'an is like a tree whose leaves are lush, its roots are embedded in the ground, its arrangement of words is smooth and pleasant to hear. The Qur'an is not the words of humans. It is very high and no one can match the beauty of its arrangement."

Hearing Abu al-Walid's answer, the Quraysh accused him of betraying them and being inclined to the religion of Islam because he had been affected by the magic of the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). From Abu al-Walid's attitude after hearing the verses of the Qur'an and the attitude of the polytheists of Mecca towards Abu al-Walid, it can be concluded that their hearts had actually acknowledged the truth of the Qur'an, had admired its content and language style, but there was something that prevented them from uttering and declaring that truth. Abu al-Walid, a person whose expertise in Arabic literature and language they had been proud of all this time, was unable to move even slightly and was fascinated to listen to the verses of the Qur'an. What about those whose knowledge is far lower than Abu al-Walid? Because there was not a single reason they could put forward, and to cover up their weaknesses, they immediately accused the Qur'an of being magic in the form of poetry, and Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) of being a magician who bewitched people with words in the form of poetry.

In another verse, it is explained that the reasons that prompted the polytheists not to acknowledge the truth of the Qur'an, even though their own hearts had acknowledged it, was their fanaticism towards the beliefs of their ancestors. Allah says:

"Nay! They say: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we guide ourselves by their footsteps." (az-Zukhruf/43: 22).

In addition to fanaticism towards the teachings of their ancestors, they were also worried about losing their position as leaders of the tribe or clan if they expressed their true feelings about the truth of the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).
text.8:
Besides accusing Muhammad saw as a sorcerer, the polytheists also accused him of fabricating and saying untrue things about Allah. Therefore, Allah commanded Muhammad saw to refute that accusation by saying, "If I were to lie by fabricating or saying untrue things about Allah, such as if I were not a messenger, but I said that I was a messenger of Allah sent to you to convey His religion, then Allah would surely inflict a very severe punishment upon me, and no one on earth would be able to save me from that punishment. Is it possible for me to fabricate something and say untrue things about Allah and the Qur'an, and make myself a target of Allah's punishment, when no one can help me from it?" Allah says:

And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings, We would have seized him by the right hand; Then We would have cut from him the aorta. And there is not among you anyone who could prevent [Us] from [punishing] him. (al-haqqah/69: 44-47).

At the end of this verse, the Messenger of Allah saw affirmed to the polytheists that Allah is All-Knowing of all their actions, words, and criticisms of the Qur'an, for example, saying that the Qur'an is magic, poetry, a lie, and so on; therefore, He will give a fitting recompense. Prophet Muhammad said that Allah is sufficient as a witness to the truth of his conveying Allah's religion to them. Allah will also be a witness to their denial and their attitude of rejecting the truth.

Furthermore, Allah commanded Prophet Muhammad to say to the polytheists that even though they disbelieve in Allah and His Messenger, as well as the Qur'an, the door of repentance remains open to them. Allah will accept their repentance as long as they truly repent to Him with the determination not to disobey Him again, and not to commit other sinful deeds. Allah wants to accept their repentance because He is Most Forgiving and continues to give mercy to those who repent and return to Him.
text.9:
In this verse, Allah commands Prophet Muhammad to say that he is not the first among the messengers. As mentioned in the vocabulary explanation, *bid'* means something new, or something that is the first of its kind. If the polytheists deny Muhammad's prophethood even though there have been many messengers of Allah since Prophet Adam to Prophet Isa, then such denial is very strange and needs to be questioned because Muhammad's being sent as a messenger is certainly not the first among the messengers. Before Prophet Muhammad, Allah had sent many prophets and messengers in every age and different places. The sending of prophets by Allah to give guidance to mankind is a universal experience of mankind, not just to improve the condition of the polytheists of Mecca. So, Muhammad's being sent to carry out the mission of the message is not something new at all.

Furthermore, Allah commands the Messenger of Allah to convey to the polytheists that he does not know in the slightest what Allah will do to him and them in this world, whether he must leave this land and migrate to another land as the previous prophets had done, or whether he will be killed like other prophets who were killed. He also does not know what will befall his people. All of that is only known by Allah, the All-Knowing. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reaffirms that even though Allah has promised to give victory to the Muslims and to defeat the disbelievers, to admit the Muslims into Paradise and to admit the disbelievers into Hell, he does not know in the slightest when that will happen.

From this verse, it can be concluded that only Allah knows all that is unseen. The messengers and the prophets do not know it, unless Allah informs them. Therefore, this verse firmly refutes the belief that the *wali* (saints) know the unseen, know what will happen. The Messenger of Allah himself, as the messenger of Allah, admits that he does not know the unseen things, let alone the *wali* whose level is far below the level of the messengers.

In a hadith narrated by Imam al-Bukhari and other imams:

From Ummul 'Ala', when 'Uthman bin Madz'un died, I prayed, "May Allah have mercy on you, O Abu al-Saib, indeed Allah has honored you." Then the Messenger of Allah rebuked, "How do you know that Allah has honored him? As for him, he has received certainty from his Lord, and I truly hope for good for him. By Allah, I do not know, even though I am the Messenger of Allah, what Allah will do to me, nor to all of you." Ummul 'Ala' said: "By Allah, since then I have never again sanctified (praised) anyone forever." (Narrated by al-Bukhari)

From the above explanation, it is clear that the Messenger of Allah himself did not know the unseen. He did not know whether his companion 'Uthman bin Madz'un, who had died, entered Paradise or Hell. However, he prayed that his companion would be given mercy by Allah. This also means that no one can predict anything about someone who has just died. The Messenger of Allah himself did not know, let alone a *wali* or a scholar. If a *wali* states that he knows the unseen, then that statement is a complete lie. The Messenger of Allah became angry hearing people guessing the fate of someone who died as mentioned in the hadith above.

This verse gives us guidance about the good attitude in facing or visiting a friend who has died. The guidance is that we should pray for him and never predict his fate, because only Allah knows that.

At the end of this verse, Allah commands the Messenger of Allah to affirm his true state to strengthen what he has conveyed. He is commanded to say to the polytheists of Mecca that there is nothing he follows except the Qur'an that Allah has revealed to him, and there is nothing that he has fabricated. Everything comes from Allah the Almighty. He is only a warner sent by Allah to convey a warning to them to guard themselves from the torment and wrath of Allah. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also affirmed that he had conveyed to them strong evidence of the truth of his message. He is not an angel, so he cannot do something that humans cannot do.
text.10:
Allah commands His Messenger to ask the polytheists what their opinion would be if it were proven that the Qur'an is truly from Allah. With the fact that no one can match it, it is proven that the Qur'an is not magic and is not fabricated, as they accuse. Nevertheless, they continue to deny and reject it, while there are some among the Children of Israel who are more knowledgeable, experienced, and intelligent than them, but still acknowledge its truth. What will God do to them? Will God not punish them for their denial and arrogance? He will not guide them, so they will all become the most misguided people in the world.

The witness from the Children of Israel refers to 'Abdullah bin Salam, according to the hadith narrated by at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Jarir, and Ibn Mardawaih from 'Abdullah bin Salam himself. He stated:

"Allah has revealed verses of the Qur'an about me. The verses revealed about me are: *wa syahida syahidun min Bani Israil 'ala mitslihi*, and the verse: *Qul kafa billahi syahidan baini wa bainakum wa man 'indahu 'ilmul kitab*." (Narrated by at-Tirmidhi)

'Abdullah bin Salam's statement is reinforced by the hadith of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him):

From Sa'ad bin Abi Waqqas, he said, "I have never heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say to anyone on earth that he is among the people of Paradise, except to 'Abdullah bin Salam; and concerning him was revealed the verse: *Wa syahida syahidun min bani Isra'ila 'ala mitslihi*." (Narrated by al-Bukhari)

'Abdullah bin Salam was a Jew from the city of Medina. He studied and understood well the contents of the Torah, which mentioned the coming of the last prophet and messenger, descended from Prophet Ibrahim, and from the lineage of Prophet Ismail, in the Arabian Peninsula, bringing the Qur'an as the book revealed to him by Allah. After the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) migrated to Medina, 'Abdullah observed the characteristics of the Prophet and the teachings he conveyed in the form of Qur'anic verses revealed to him by Allah.

He observed the Prophet's attitude towards fellow human beings and the attitude of his followers who had delved into the new religion. Finally, he concluded that the Prophet and the religious teachings he brought had the same characteristics as those indicated in the Torah that he had studied and practiced. Similarly, the characteristics of the followers of the new religion. Therefore, he declared himself to have embraced Islam and become a follower of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).

Thus, it can be understood that Jews and Christians who truly follow and believe in the Torah and the Gospel will certainly come to the conclusion that the Qur'an is truly from Allah and that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is truly His messenger, as 'Abdullah bin Salam did.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that the polytheists are actually arrogant people who deny the verses of Allah. Therefore, they have wronged themselves. As a result of such attitudes and actions, Allah no longer gives them guidance. This is in accordance with *sunatullah* that Allah will not give guidance to every wrongdoer. They receive the wrath of Allah in this world and in the hereafter.
text.11:
This verse explains that the words of the polytheists of Mecca about the Qur'an and those who believe are not true. They uttered those words because some people they considered poor, ignorant, and of low status, such as 'Ammar, Suhaib, Ibn Mas'ud, Bilal, Khabbab, and others, had embraced Islam. According to them, something that is true and comes from God must be acknowledged as true by the nobles, the rich, the respected, and the dignitaries. That was their measure of truth. If the truth is only acknowledged by people of low status, the poor, and the common people, then that truth is false.

The words of the polytheists of Mecca were, "If the Qur'an revealed to Muhammad (peace be upon him) contained goodness, then surely we, the respected, the nobles, and the prominent people, would have believed in it first because we know and do good deeds before those of low status. Now, they are the ones who believe before us. This can be used as evidence that the Qur'an has no value and contains no goodness whatsoever."

Qatadah said, "The polytheists stated, we are more powerful. If there is any good, surely we are the ones who know it best. Because we know best, surely we are the ones who determine it. No one can precede us in this matter. In connection with their words, this verse was revealed."

According to one narration, when the tribes of Juhainah, Muzainah, Aslam, and Gifar embraced Islam, Banu 'Amir, Bani Gatafan, and Banu Asad said, "If the religion of Islam were true, surely we would not be preceded by those animal herders."

Because the hearts, hearing, and sight of those polytheists had been locked by envy and lust, they could no longer take guidance from the Qur'an, and accused the Qur'an of being a false report, tales of the ancients, magic, fabricated by Muhammad, and meaningless at all. The accusations of the polytheists are also explained in Allah's words:

And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not but a falsehood he has invented, and another people have assisted him in it." And they have committed injustice and falsehood. And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon." (al-Furqan/25: 4-5)

According to Islamic teachings, a person's faith and piety are not related to their status, whether they are rich or poor, noble or slave, ruler or commoner, and knowledgeable or unknowledgeable. Anyone, regardless of their nation, skin color, and level in society, can become a believing and pious Muslim because the essence of faith and piety is the purity of the heart, the desire to seek the ultimate truth, and the ability to control lust. In a hadith it is mentioned:

Beware, in the body there is a morsel of flesh which, if it be sound, all the body is sound and which, if it be diseased, all the body is diseased. Beware, it is the heart. (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from an-Nu'man bin Basyir)
text.12:
This verse refutes the accusations of the polytheists against the Quran and proves its truth by saying, "O disbelievers, you have all witnessed that Allah has revealed the Torah, which contains the principles of religion brought by Prophet Musa and as a mercy for the Children of Israel. The Torah revealed to Prophet Musa alludes to the coming of Muhammad as the last prophet and messenger who brings the Quran in Arabic, confirming the previous books revealed by Allah so that with that book he may warn all mankind, give good news to those who practice its contents, and warn that Allah's punishment and threats will befall those who deny it."

Even though the existing Torah has been much tainted by human hands, there are still many verses that allude to the coming of Prophet Muhammad saw as the last and most perfect prophet and messenger. This can be read in Genesis 13:2, 3; 15; 16:10, 12 and many more. In Genesis 21:13, the coming of the greatest prophet from the descendants of Prophet Ismail is explained, "And also of the son of the bondwoman will I make a nation, because he is thy seed."

Likewise in Genesis 21:13, "Arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for I will make him a great nation."

Also in Genesis 17:20, "And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee: Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation."

Of course, the verses of the Torah above refer to Prophet Muhammad. Prophet Musa in Deuteronomy 18:17-22 also stated the coming of Prophet Muhammad saw:

"And the Lord said unto me (Moses), They have well spoken that which they have spoken. I will raise them up a Prophet from among their brethren, like unto thee (O Moses), and will put my words in his mouth; and he shall speak unto them all that I shall command him.

And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.

But the prophet, which shall presume to speak a word in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or that shall speak in the name of other gods, even that prophet shall die.

And if thou say in thine heart, How shall we know the word which the Lord hath not spoken?

When a prophet speaketh in the name of the Lord, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the Lord hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him."

In the six verses of the Torah above, there are several allusions that can be used as evidence to state the prophecy about Prophet Muhammad. From the words "a prophet from among their brethren" it shows that the person prophesied by God will come from the brothers of the Children of Israel, not from the Children of Israel themselves. As for the brothers of the Children of Israel, they are the Children of Ismail (the Arabs) because Ismail is the older brother of Isaac, the father of Israel (Jacob). And Prophet Muhammad saw clearly came from the descendants of Ismail.

Then the phrase "Like unto thee" gives the understanding that the prophet who will come must be like Prophet Musa, meaning, a prophet who brings a new religion like Musa. As is known, Prophet Muhammad is the one who brought a new sharia (Islamic religion) which also applies to the Children of Israel.

Then it is explained again that the Prophet is not arrogant and will not be killed. Muhammad saw, as is known, was not an arrogant person, both before becoming a prophet and after becoming a prophet. Before becoming a prophet, he was already liked by his community, proven by the title al-Amin, meaning "the trustworthy one." If he were arrogant, he would certainly not have been given that very praiseworthy title. After becoming a prophet, he was even more friendly.

Christians acknowledge that prophecy to Prophet Isa, in addition to acknowledging that Isa died. This clearly contradicts the prophecy itself, because the prophet in question must not die (be crucified or for other reasons).

Those are the affirmations given by the prophets before the coming of Prophet Muhammad saw. All of them were known by the disbelievers of Mecca who denied the prophethood of Muhammad saw.
text.13: This verse explains the state of those who truly believe in Allah, namely those who acknowledge and say, "Our Lord is Allah," then they are istiqamah, that is, steadfast in that acknowledgment, not mixed in the slightest with acts of shirk. Such a person consistently follows the path that religion has determined, following Allah's commands truthfully, and avoiding His prohibitions. So, such people will have no fear within themselves on the Day of Judgment, because Allah guarantees their safety. They do not need to grieve over what they left behind in the world after death, nor over anything that escaped and was lost from them during their life in this world, and there is no regret whatsoever in themselves.
text.14:
In this verse, Allah affirms that those who believe in Allah and then remain steadfast in their faith by performing acts of worship and obeying Allah's commands, continuing to trust in Him, and avoiding His prohibitions, will obtain eternal happiness in the Hereafter, namely becoming inhabitants of Paradise and abiding therein forever. For them are prepared various delights in Paradise, as a reward for their righteous deeds in the world.

The attitude of *istiqamah* after believing and performing acts of worship to Allah is important and highly commendable, as in the hadith of the Prophet (peace be upon him) which commands us all:

Say, "I believe in Allah," and then be steadfast. (Narrated by Muslim from Sufyan bin 'Abdullah ats-saqafi)
text.15:
It is narrated that this verse was revealed in connection with Abu Bakr. He was among the fortunate ones because he was among the closest companions to the Prophet Muhammad (saw). One of his daughters, 'Aisyah, was the wife of the Messenger of Allah (saw), and both his parents, Abu Quhafah and Ummul Khair binti Shakhar bin Amir, had embraced Islam, as had his other children and siblings. He repented, was grateful, and prayed to Allah for obtaining such unparalleled blessings.

Allah commands all humans to be kind to their parents, both when they are alive and after they have passed away. Being kind means performing all good deeds in accordance with religious teachings. Being kind to parents means respecting them, taking care of them, and providing for them if they no longer have an income. Meanwhile, being kind to parents after they have passed away means always praying to Allah for them to be rewarded and for their sins to be forgiven. Being kind to parents is an act of great value in the sight of Allah, while being disobedient to them is a major sin.

Children are the continuation of life for their parents; hopes or deeds that could not be accomplished during their lifetime are expected to be continued by their children. Therefore, children are also the hope of their parents, not only while they are alive but also after they have passed away. In a hadith of the Messenger of Allah (saw), it is explained that among the deeds whose rewards will not cease to be received by a person even after they have passed away is the prayer from their righteous children, which is always directed to their parents.

The Messenger of Allah (saw) said:

When a person dies, his deeds come to an end except for three: sadaqah jariyah (ongoing charity), beneficial knowledge, or a righteous child who prays for him. (Narrated by Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

From this hadith, it can be understood that parents should educate their children to become people who are obedient to Allah, love to do good deeds, carry out Allah's commands, and avoid His prohibitions. Education can be done in various ways, such as through schooling, education at home, setting a good example, and so on. Only righteous children who are obedient to Allah and love to do good deeds can be devoted and pray for their parents.

In this verse, Allah explains specifically why one should be kind to their mother. This specification indicates that when a child is about to be kind to their parents, the mother should be given priority over the father. This is because the mother's attention, sacrifice, and suffering are greater and more numerous in caring for and educating the child compared to the attention, sacrifice, and suffering experienced by the father. Among the sacrifices, attention, and suffering of the mother are:

1.  The mother carries the child in a state of full trials and suffering. Initially, the pregnancy feels light, even though changes have begun to occur in her, such as loss of appetite, feelings of anxiety, sometimes nausea, vomiting, and so on. The longer the pregnancy, the heavier it becomes. The heavier the pregnancy, the heavier the trials borne by the mother, until the moment of childbirth. The trial is almost unbearable, feeling as if life will end.

2.  After the child is born, the mother cares for and breastfeeds him. The period of pregnancy and breastfeeding is 30 months. A verse of the Qur'an explains that the most perfect breastfeeding period is two years. Allah says:

And mothers should breastfeed their children for two full years, for those who desire to complete the term [of breastfeeding]. (al-Baqarah/2: 233)

This verse explains that the period of breastfeeding and pregnancy is 30 months. This means that the mother must devote her attention during the period of pregnancy and breastfeeding, which is 30 months.

In connection with this verse, there is a narration that says that a woman gave birth in the sixth month of pregnancy. The matter was brought to 'Uthman bin 'Affan, the caliph at that time. 'Uthman intended to carry out the *hadd* punishment (stoning) because the woman was suspected of having committed adultery before entering into a marriage contract. Then 'Ali bin Abi Talib presented an opinion to 'Uthman, saying, "Allah (swt) states that the breastfeeding period is two years (24 months), and in this verse, it is stated that the period of pregnancy and breastfeeding is 30 months. This means that the pregnancy period is at least 6 months. This means that the woman cannot be punished by stoning because she gave birth during the pregnancy period specified in the verse." Hearing this, 'Uthman bin 'Affan changed his original opinion and followed the opinion of 'Ali bin Abi Talib.

Ibn 'Abbas said, "If a woman is pregnant for nine months, it is sufficient for her to breastfeed her child for 21 months; if she is pregnant for 7 months, it is sufficient for her to breastfeed her child for 23 months; and if she is pregnant for 6 months, she breastfeeds her child for 24 months."

Therefore, it is very wise if a child is breastfed with breast milk (ASI), in accordance with the teachings of the Qur'an and also in accordance with the guidance of medical science, unless due to compelling circumstances it can be replaced with other milk products.

3.  The mother is the one who has the most contact with the child in caring for and educating him, until the child is able to be independent. The mother's obligation to care for and educate her child is not only during the time that the mother is bound by marriage to the child's father, but also when she has divorced the child's father.

The mother's love and affection for her child is a decree from Allah, as stated in His word:

And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. (Luqman/31: 14)

In connection with the above issue, the Messenger of Allah (saw) answered a companion's question in one of the hadith:

From Bahz bin Hakim from his father from his grandfather, may Allah be pleased with him, he said, "I said, 'O Messenger of Allah, to whom should I be dutiful?' The Messenger of Allah replied, 'To your mother.' I said, 'Then to whom?' The Messenger of Allah replied, 'To your mother.' I said, 'Then to whom?' The Messenger of Allah replied, 'To your mother.' I said, 'Then to whom?' The Messenger of Allah said, 'To your father, then to your closest relatives, then the next closest.'" (Narrated by Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi)

As for the father's responsibility as a parent, it is as the head of the family who is responsible for caring for, providing for, and maintaining the peace and harmony of the family. The father as the leader of the family can divide tasks to his wife, older children, and other family members who live in the family. The spiritual responsibility as a father is to bring the family closer to Allah, perform worship correctly, and give birth to a new generation, as Allah says:

And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous." (al-Furqan/25: 74)

This verse explains the good attitude of a child towards his parents who have cared for him from childhood to adulthood, at times when his parents have become elderly, weak, and senile. At that time, the child is around 40 years old, he prays, "O my Lord, give me guidance and direction to be grateful for Your unparalleled blessings that You have given me, both those related to guidance so that I can carry out Your commands and avoid Your prohibitions, and the guidance that You have given to my parents so that they pour out their love and affection for me, since I was still in the womb, when I was still small until I grew up. O my Lord, accept all my deeds and instill in me the spirit to do good deeds that are in accordance with Your pleasure, and guide my descendants to follow the straight path; make them people who are pious and do good deeds."

In connection with this verse, Ibn 'Abbas said, "Whoever has reached the age of 40, while his good deeds have not been able to overcome his evil deeds, then he should prepare to enter hell."

In another narration, Ibn 'Abbas said, "Allah has granted the prayer of Abu Bakr. He freed nine believing slaves, including Bilal and Amir bin Fuhairah. He never intended to do a good deed, but Allah helped him. He prayed, "O my Lord, give goodness to myself, by giving goodness to my grandchildren. Make goodness and piety become the flesh and blood of my descendants." Allah has granted his prayer. Not one of his children did not believe in Allah; his parents and his children all believed. Therefore, no one among the companions of the Messenger of Allah obtained such a virtue as this.

Narrated by Abu Dawud from Ibn Mas'ud in his Sunan that the Messenger of Allah (saw) once taught the following prayer:

O my Lord, instill compassion in our hearts; instill peace among us, guide us to the path of safety. Release us from darkness and guide us to the bright light. Keep us away from all abominations, both outward and inward. Bless us in our hearing, in our sight, in our hearts, in our wives, in our descendants. Accept our repentance, for You are the Most Accepting of Repentance, the Most Merciful. Make us people who are always grateful for Your blessings and praise You, because of Your giving of blessings and perfect Your blessings upon us. (Narrated by Abu Dawud)
text.16:
This verse explains the reward that will be received by righteous people who possess the characteristics of righteous children, as mentioned in the previous verse. Such people are those who have the best deeds during their lives in the world according to Allah's view because of their sincerity, obedience, and compliance in carrying out His religion. People like that will have all their sins forgiven because they always repent to Him with true repentance. They will obtain a paradise full of delights in the Hereafter.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that the reward mentioned comes from Allah, and all that He has promised, both the promise to reward those who believe and the warning to punish the disbelievers, will surely be fulfilled; not one of them will be denied.
text.17:
This verse explains Allah's threat to those who, when invited by their parents to believe in Allah and the Hereafter, say, "Ah, what are you two saying? I am not pleased with you two saying that I will be resurrected from the grave alive, after I die and am completely destroyed with the earth. Is it possible that flesh that has been destroyed with the earth and scattered bones can be reassembled and become a living body as before? How strange and ridiculous is that belief, O my parents. Haven't many people in the past, before us, done everything according to their desires? Some of them followed the teachings of the messengers who were sent to them, and many of them denied them, but none of them have been resurrected as you two say. If what you two say is true, we would certainly see the evidence now, and we would certainly meet our ancestors who died long ago."

Hearing their son's answer, sadness and pity arose in the hearts of the parents. They felt sad because of their son's attitude, which seemed to disrespect them. They felt pity because they were sure that their son would receive Allah's punishment in the Hereafter. Even so, they did not give up calling their son and pleading to Allah, the Most Gracious. They said, "Believe, O my son, that Allah will surely fulfill His promise, and you should be sure that you will truly be resurrected later, because Allah's promise is a true promise, which will surely be fulfilled, may Allah give you guidance."

Allah forbids a child from saying "ah" to his mother and father, or other words that hurt his parents' hearts, because both have rendered services in caring for and educating him since childhood, even since in the womb until adulthood, as Allah says:

And We have enjoined on man (to be good) to his parents. His mother carried him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is the final destination. (Luqman/31: 14)

If parents educate their children to believe in Allah and the Hereafter, then the child refuses and says "ah," that is a great disobedience and a clear error. In another verse it is mentioned:

And your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him, and that you be dutiful to your parents. If one of them or both of them attain old age in your care, never say to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word. (al-Isra'/17: 23)

Responding to the invitation of his parents, the son answered with an attitude of belittling them by saying that his parents' invitation to believe in Allah and the Hereafter was just an old wives' tale. He assumed that his parents had been influenced by false tales so that they acknowledged their truth. According to him, the existence of the Day of Resurrection is a belief that is impossible to happen.
text.18:
Allah threatens every child who behaves as described in the verse above towards their parents. They will surely be afflicted with torment in the Hereafter, receive Allah's wrath and anger, and be cast into a blazing Hellfire, along with the previous communities who disobeyed Allah, denied the messengers, and mocked their parents, whether they were from the jinn or mankind. Thus, Hell will be filled with all of them as promised by Allah.

From this verse, it can be understood that jinn are creatures of Allah who have the same obligations as humans. Among them, some adhere to Islam like Muslims, and some are disbelievers. They live, procreate, and die like humans.

Abu Hayyan said, "Al-Hasan al-Basri said in a *halaqah* (lesson assembly), "Jinn do not die." Then Qatadah refuted him by presenting this verse. Then al-Hasan al-Basri fell silent.

At the end of this verse, it is explained that the reason Allah punishes them, jinn and humans, is because they are the losers. They lose because they have wasted the *fitrah* that Allah has given them. Since in the womb, humans have been given by God an instinct, namely the potential to become believers. However, the potential within them is wasted, by following their desires and the temptations of Satan, and being influenced by worldly life and the environment, so that they become losers in this world, let alone in the Hereafter.

Blessed are those who can utilize the *fitrah* that Allah has instilled in them so that they believe in Allah and His Messenger, and always receive guidance, *hidayah*, and *taufik* in their lives. Allah SWT says:

"So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. (Adhere to) the *fitrah* of Allah upon which He has created (all) people. No change should there be in the creation of Allah. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know." (ar-Rum/30: 30)
text.19:
Allah explains that humans and jinn have specific ranks in His sight on the Day of Judgment, according to the deeds and actions they performed during their lives in the world. Those who believe and do good deeds are divided into several ranks of varying heights, while those who disbelieve in Allah are also divided into several ranks of varying depths. The difference in the height or depth of the rank is due to differences in a person's faith and deeds, in addition to differences in disbelief and disobedience. In other words, Allah determines these different ranks because of the differences in the actions of humans and jinn themselves. Some of them are steadfast in faith and have many good deeds, while others are weak and have few. Similarly, regarding disbelief, some people are very disbelieving in Allah, while others are less disbelieving and denying. The most noble person in the sight of Allah is the one who is most pious towards Him.

Allah provides different ranks to prove His justice to His creation, and to be able to give perfect recompense to every jinn and human. Acts of piety are rewarded according to the level of piety, and acts of disbelief are also rewarded according to the level of disbelief.
text.20:
After explaining that every jinn and human will receive just recompense from Him, Allah explains the condition of the disbelievers when they are brought before Hell. Allah commands the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to convey to the disbelievers their condition when they are brought into Hell. It will be said to them that all kinds of happiness and pleasures intended for them have been fully and perfectly received during their life in the world. There is nothing left for them to enjoy in the Hereafter. What remains is only humiliation, degradation, and a painful torment that they will experience as retribution for the arrogance, wickedness, injustice, disobedience, and disbelief they committed during their life in the world.

This verse warns people to abandon excessive luxury, to abandon wasteful acts, disobedience, and encourages Muslims to live simply, not excessively using things according to their needs and circumstances, and in accordance with the purpose of a Muslim's life. If there is excess wealth, it should be given to the poor, the abandoned, and orphans who have no one to take responsibility for them, and use the wealth to elevate the word of Allah.

Narrated by al-Baihaqi and others from Ibn 'Umar that 'Umar saw a dirham in the hand of Jabir bin 'Abdullah, so he said, "What is that dirham?" Jabir replied, "I intend to buy a piece of meat that my family has been longing for." 'Umar said, "Every time you desire something, you buy it? What do you think about this verse? 'You exhausted your good things in your worldly life and enjoyed them.'"

From the above narration, we can learn that 'Umar bin al-Khaththab advised Jabir bin 'Abdullah with this verse not to indulge his desires too much and reminded him that the pleasures and happiness in this world are only temporary, while the eternal happiness is in the Hereafter. Therefore, we must use all the sustenance that Allah has bestowed in the best possible way, in accordance with the provisions outlined by religion.

This simple life is reflected in the life of the family of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as mentioned in the hadith:

Narrated from Thauban, he said, "When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was about to travel, the last family he visited was Fatimah. And the first family he visited when he returned from a journey was Fatimah. He returned from Ghazah (war), then he came to Fatimah's house, and he wiped the door of the house and saw silver bracelets on the hands of Hasan and Hussein, he turned back and did not enter. When Fatimah saw that, she thought that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not enter her house because he saw those things.
